It is weird though, because alcohol is definitely not good if we view things in binaries. Like it is addictive, extremely unhealthy, and potentially highly destructive... you'd think that something that ruins so many people's life would be more of a taboo than something like weed.

I think there are many reasons for it, one of them is that culturally speaking alcohol is way more accepted than other types of drugs, to the point where we at least in the western world think about being able to buy alcohol legally as a passage into adulthood. And since it has been legal for such a long time, it might be weird to some people to categorise with illegal substances.

Well I think it is important to keep in mind that this from the perspective of a film maker, which is a valid one for sure, but the consumer is important as well. Like I am sure he would want me to watch his movies on the best format possible, and ideally something better than my mac, but that is what I gotta work with.
I do agree with what he is saying though, but I am not going to tell anyone how to enjoy movies, so if they like watching it on their phones then I don't mind.

I don't mind other people doing it, because if they enjoy movies that way the more power to them, but I just don't like it honestly. Like it is not about it being a discredit to cinema or anything like that, it is just an unpleasant format to watch anything besides youtube vids on in my opinion. I just don't feel immersed when I watch anything on a phone, and I can't really concentrate, and there is no comfortable way to watch it.
So yeah, I think watching movies or TV shows on my phone sucks, but not for any meaningful reason.

Yeah I only watch movies in theatres or on my laptop, like of course it would nice to have like decently sized TV, but I don't have the money or the space for it... so a laptop and headphones will have to do for the time being.
But I don't have any degenerate fetishes..

How it is disturbing? Either you don't know what harassment is, or you deliberately miscategorised it, so either you lied or you were just wrong. Because again, it isn't harassment, that is not up for debate. If tou are not being slandered or disparaged, and nobody is attacking you, then isn't harassment.
I don't confuse the issue, I just don't think the mods are responsible for echo chambers, they are just trying to prevent bad behaviour. If there is enough reason to suspect that you cannot be trusted, then that is perfectly reason to ban you. Like for an instance if you post on anti-LGBTQ subs, (not saying you do) then why should you be allowed to post on pro-LBGTQ subs? Isn't there reason to suspect that you are there solely to harass people?
And it is nothing like doxxing as no personal information is being brought up and spread around, going through your post history might be shitty, but it ain't anything like doxxing.
How so? Bigotry is irrational and illogical, right?
Seems like the typical clickbait they indulge in though

Saying that they harass people when they don't is a lie, because banning people from a sub isn't a form of systemic harassment, that is just false. So yeah it is a lie.
And I just don't buy it, because the echo chamber is not at the fault of moderators, it is our (as in the users) fault. Because even in subs where you don't get banned because of guilt by association, people still upvote and downvote based on whether or not they agree with us. The mods wanting to protect people from harassment is not that big of a deal in comparison. If people over at the that sub didn't harass people, they probably wouldn't have to deal with any of this.
